title: Monetary policy and financial capital flows

content.question: A contractionary monetary policy by the Canadian central bank will likely affect international financial capital flows and the Canadian dollar in which of the following ways in the short run?

choices.label: Financial capital flows from Canada will increase, and the Canadian dollar will appreciate.
Financial capital flows from Canada will increase, and the Canadian dollar will depreciate.
Financial capital flows from Canada will increase, and the value of the Canadian dollar will not change.
Financial capital flows to Canada will increase, and the Canadian dollar will depreciate.
Financial capital flows to Canada will increase, and the Canadian dollar will appreciate.

content.answer: Financial capital flows to Canada will increase, and the Canadian dollar will appreciate.

unit.text: 6: Open Economy - International Trade and Finance

topic.text: 6.6: Real Interest Rates and International Capital Flows

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine the effect(s) of one or more changes on other economic markets.
